text:
Thanks Kirk for sharing the bottle! Poured into a taster showing pitch black with half a finger of latte colored foam. 

The nose shows a strong lactose forwardness matched by a strong black coffee background and hints of fig. 

The palate is light bodied and lightly carbonated for a stout. Despite the nose, there is only a light lactose sweetness and countered with a lot of intense dark roasted coffee character. Coffee character is perfectly restrained and balanced without entering the burnt or toasted territory. Finish is short as there is practically no bitterness given the strong espresso character on the front end. Very well done for the flavors in terms of balance and restraint but could use a bit more character..

Pours a black color with a tan head. Soft rich sweet coffee and roasted flavors with a nice light carbonation. Chocolate and coffee aromas.

Notes: Bottle from brewery visit, Dec 16.

18/XI/16 - 500ml bottle @ Sebs Farewell Tasting (Eugenes place) - BB: n/a (2016-1328) Thanks to ElManana+1 for sharing the bottle!
Little hazy dark brown beer, practically no had. Aroma: coffee, coffee and more coffee. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: coffee, alcohol, bit sourish, more coffee, bit sweet, caramel. Aftertaste: little bitter, hoppy and earthy notes, and once again, coffee and more coffee. Well, since coffee aint my thing, neither is this.

"Double Shot 500". Pours black with a nice frothy mocha head. Nose is roasted malts, freshly ground coffee beans, sweet cream. Nice. Ooh, mouth is even better, with a big, creamy collage of fresh coffee, sweet cream (Irish cream?), roasted malts, and something more, like dried berries or other dark fruits. Maybe a touch of raisin and fig. Really good actually. Super creamy mouth feel. One of the more elite Tree House brews.

50cl bottle, courtesy of El Manana + 1 @ Sebletitjes Farewell Tasting.
Brune foncée, col fin beige.
Arôme au nez puissant niveau du café sans pour cela me faire tomber sous le charme. Retrouve un malt grillé, sorte de chocolat-praliné espresso avec touche de caramel. Les effluves sont fortement marquees par le café.
Palais est dominé par le café, malt caramel, grillé avec une fine amertume café - houblon en fin de bouche. La version El Salvador me laisse un meilleur souvenir.
Reste solide mais peut devenir bcp pour une seule personne.

Thank you ElManana + Sanne! 500 ml. bottle sampled @ Sebletitjes Farewell Tasting. Didnt know that Tree House bottled. Dark brown going to black, little head. Nose is big mocha, chocolate, huge coffee, good quality big roasted coffee upfront, some sugary sweetness in the back .Taste is bitter roast, great quality roasted coffee dominates pretty much everything, very bitter coffee in a good way, vauge mocha & sugar sweetness in the back. Medium bodied with huge coffee feel. Massive coffee, very nice straightforward coffee beer.

Bottle shared by ElManana & Sanne @ Sebletitjes Farewell tasting. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized dark brown color. Aroma is huge coffee and espresso. Taste malts, huge coffee and espresso, roast bitter. Lovely.
Bottle shared @ Sebletitjes Farewell tasting. Daaaammnnn, coffee, espresso, some chocolate, thick for the ABV, AWESOME.
500 ml. bottle. Thanks Mike! Pours black with a nice fluffy tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, and malt. Taste is coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, and some vanilla. Very, very good.

Due to artificial lighting, arbitrary rating for Appearance  Expressly coffee - and nothing else... Sweet coffee, getting liqueurish, and not unlike fortified wine. Sweet chocolate..Very thick - voluptuous, good carbonation. Quite good, but the nose is just coffee.  Thx to M & L V!
Bottle at Mongers. Pours a dark brown black color with a small white head. A big sweet coffee nose. Rich espresso, ash, chocolate, light roast. Solid brew. Very flavorful.

Bottle. Thanks!

A: Pitch black, mocha head, legs.

N: Coffee, cocoa, vanilla, burnt brown sugar, espresso, biscuit.

T: Sweet and lightly bitter. A bit smokey.
 
M: Medium - heavy body, no alcohol, soft carbonation

O: Solid. I prefer Barley Browns Breakfast, but this will do..

Bottle shared.
Medium creamy tan head. Clear black pour. Huge coffee aftertaste. Slight alcohol burn. Very good.
Bottle. Aroma is all coffee bean. Tastes like roasted coffee mostly with a slightly artificial nutty taste and light soy sauce. Very odd. Not my favorites

Courtesy of northernbrews
Bottle: The aroma consists of heavy coffee/espresso, moderate chocolate, and hints of cream. It pours a dark brown with no transparency and and a small beige head that fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin ring. The flavor starts with moderate chocolate with a hint of molasses. The finish has moderate-heavy coffee/espresso and a touch of vanilla. Its medium-full bodied with mild carbonation and a somewhat soft mouthfeel.

500ml bottle thanks to Steve. pours out black topped with a big fluffy tan head. nose is big coffee cream milk chocolate sweetness roast malts. Taste is more of the heavy roast malts chocolate sweetness big coffee.

Bottle thanks to Brian. Pours black with small tan head that lasts. The aroma is strong roast coffee bean, dark chocolate, wood. Thick mouth, roast, cocoa, wood, vanilla, very bitter finish, really good.
Pitch black with a good brown head. Intense aromas of cold brewed coffee. Full bodied, sweet upfront, low carbonation, very sweet...coffee, indeed. Smooth!

I was craving coffee but didnt feel like making any, so I opened this. Amazingly done. Lots of coffee. Espresso. Sweet. Not acidic, not charred, just smooth. If you like coffee, youll love this. Thx for the trade tbub18!

Growler in line at MBC Dinner release. This really tastes scarily similar to a café au lait -- the coffee flavor and aroma is huge, and instead of putting it into an imperial stout (like a lot of breweries would do), the concept of putting it onto a creamy, slightly sweet milk stout is a stroke of genius. I found the Single Shot to be a little too sweet for my palate, but the bigger ABV and the higher quantity of coffee really bumped this up to a fantastic level.

Growler fill, 3 weeks old. Dark black with thick, oily, slow fading, espresso colored head. Nose is rich, high quality, cold press coffee, caramel, dark chocolate, and prune. Taste is bitter up front, with a sweet middle (almost like a milk stout), and then a long slightly bitter roast finish. So rich and smooth with tremendous mouthfeel. Amazing what theyve packed into this beer at just 7.6%.
Bottle. Nose is huge fresh coffee, some chocolate. Taste is fresh coffee, chocolate, sweet and syrupy.

Den Haag tasting at Maakuns. Bottle courtesy of Maakun. Black with thin tan head. Amazing roasted coffee taste, dark bitter chocolate, espresso everywhere, nutty, earthy superfine espresso. Sweet and smooth coffee bitter, smooth texture, velvet, dry bitter chocolate finish. Shut up and take my money !

Bottle shared. Black with short lasting creamy light brown head. Massive coffee beans, lots of milk chocolate, cocoa, cookies, maple syrup, dark sugar, roasted malts, super soft chalky notes. Over medium sweet with light roasted bitterness. Over medium bodied with slick feel and soft carbonation with a light dry finish. Massive. Every bit as good as the triple shot, but here the coffee shines through even more.

Poured from growler into a tulip: Pours dark brown / black with a thin tan head. Aroma is a complete coffee bomb, a little bit of toffee, and cocoa. Taste is more of the same, a tiny bit of sweetness, but the roasted coffee notes overtake everything. If you like coffee stouts (I do) this one is fantastic.
25 oz flip top from brewery. Pours jet black with thick tan head. Aroma is Coffee, Malt and Chocolate. Taste is sweet chocolate and coffee with a coffee burnt sugar finish. Delicious beer.

Growler filled 2/13/16 and drunk 2/20/16, thanks to blisscent.Lovely pour shows a cascading burnt sienna head atop a moderately hazy milk chocolate color. Head retention is strong.Rich bread and chocolate in the nose are joined by toffee and lactose-influenced vinousness. Espresso, coffee grind, vanilla; its all there. The coffee and lactose are quite prominent, perhaps dominant, but not overdone. No alcohol or flaws noted.Its hard to not hold this to an Imperial Stout/Double Stout-type of rating, but its important to keep in mind these are certainly not that. While still a big, rather rich stout, its not a thick, chewy, booze/roast/malt bomb that many/most Imperial Stouts tend to be. Rather, the milk sugar and the espresso do the talking and the body while respectable, is much lighter than what youd expect. A bit of syrup from the lactose/coffee and some very heavy "breadiness" or almost a popcorn and grit-like character. I find it in all three of the shot series beers and its a bit off-putting (texturally, for the most part). Light anise-flecked bitterness on the end.

64 oz. growler from blisscent. Thanks Nelson! Aroma is espresso beans, road malt, maybe a hint of sugar. 
Flavor is heavy on expresso bean with a chocolate candy bar base malt bill. Mouthfeel is exactly want I want in the style... Smooth, creamy texture, mild carbonation with a full body. Dry roast... Wow 
Based on the coffee and mouthfeel this is pretty bitching. Very enjoyable.

Poured from growler thanks Blisscent dark chocolate pour with a nice tan head. Aromas of coffee chocolate coconut and vanilla. Taste is creamy coffee more coffe vanilla and caramel chocolate. Rich creamy mouthfeel. Awesome.

Thanks Nelson for sharing this one. half a gallon growler...please have vanilla flavor added. I had no idea this had Stumptown coffee. Interesting

A - totally black, looks a bit oily, a really god creamy coffee frothy head appeared and faded to a thin line. 

S - Smells fantastic. Loads of cold-brew coffee, some cream, coconut and vanilla. slightly woody.

T - Coffee for days and days. theres a little bit of liquor, fudge, coffee, espresso, creamy. 

M - Exceptional creaminess.

O - There is no booze to this. Only 7.5% but it has a nice taste and overall, a great experience. It could be a little bit more roasty.

Black body with a medium sized tan head, and nice frothy lacing. Deep roasted notes, with coffee, bittersweet chocolate, caramel, espresso, and char. Medium to full bodied, restrained sweetness, mild earthy bitterness, lingering roasty finish.

Growler. Pours opaque black, large creamy dark brown head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is coffee, roast, more coffee, cocoa, light ashtray, mocha. Flavor is medium sweet, medium bitter, huge coffee mocha forward, whoah. Full body, creamy mouthfeel.

Black with foamy tan head; aroma is sweet rich coffee hoc roasty peppery notes; flava is sweet hints of molasses chocolate and coffe but not distinctly any; feels medium and creamy with lively fizz; finishes tangy roasty

750ml growler shared by Dan P. Huge thanks bro! Poured black with a small creamy dark tan head. Aroma is solid. Huge notes of fresh ground espresso, black malts, and dark chocolate. Disappointed in the taste. Sweet dark malts, dark roasted coffee beans, caramel, and vanilla. Was expecting way more in the flavor department! Aroma is the big winner here
Dark black pour. Massive coffee nose. Smooth taste, no bitterness. Sweet finish.

Snifter at Five Eyed Fox, turners Falls MA. Good aroma. Sweet. Coffee/ espresso, dark brownish black color good head and lace. Sweet bitter flavor. Heavy body creamy oily mouthfeel , bitter sweet finish thats a nice stout big on coffee, really all coffee, but I like it. Not sure if this is the regular double shot or a varietal ,
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Amazing aroma like chocolate covered coffee beans. Pitch black pour with a thin brown head. Flavor is right on point, deep and roasted, intense coffee and dark chocolate. Truly spectacular!
Growler, pour is black low head. Aroma is really smooth and roast coffee, like fresh ground beans. Taste is rich smooth coffee and roast, well balanced and delicious

Pouring at EBF 2014. Pours a deep brown to black with a thin tan head. Huge coffee on the nose, roast, hints of vanilla. Medium bodied, sweet coffee, cream and sugar. Long roast, coffee bitterness. Lovely. A touch sweet, but lovely.

On tap @ The Festival 2014. Black pour with a small layer of tan foam. A lot of rich, spicy coffee on the nose. Slight vanilla and caramel sweetness. Roast, cocoa powder, and a mild nuttiness. Flavor has a moderate bitterness of coffee, roast, and cocoa. However, a nice sweet balance to it. Plenty of caramel and dried blueberry. I liked this more than the maple one.

[ Keg ][ 3oz ][ The Festival LA ][ $3 ][ Taster ][ 11.8.14 ]
>> Inky black pour, perfect tan foam, great lacing. Nose is a tad muted with fresh coffee. Taste is coffee forward, rich vanilla, oak, creamer, bitter cocoa. Medium-full bodied. Easy to enjoy. No stickiness, no sugar, no green coffee, no off flavors, no soy. Bitterness is medium for style. Carbonation is higher for style. Really nice overall.
Tap, dark pour, tan head, nose is coffee, taste is coffee, rich, cocoa, lovely

P: Completly black with a creame dark brown head. S: Just freaking coffee, with a bit of vanilla cream and hazelnut cream. T: Just coffee with some acidy notes, roasted malts and hazelnut cream. M: Super soft and gentle. O: Great stuff using great coffee.
Taster at the source. Pours nearly black with a brown head. Aroma is full of chocolate and dark coffee. Mmmm. Dry toasty stout with dark chocolate and coffee flavors.

Thanks to jlindros. Ethiopia Yirgacheffe version. Pours black, essentially no brown showing at the edges. Nice foamy head of light brown cream. Pretty good lacing, particularly for a growler pour. Very good retention, too. Aroma has a big shot of coffee on top of a good amount of chocolate. Really nice roasty coffee. Some fruit but its more of a chocolate, roast mix. Creamy and nice. Reminiscent of Vietnamese Speedway, which is probably my favorite coffee stout. The flavor follows the aroma. Lots of coffee, seems a bit fruitier than the aroma. Chocolate isnt quite as big, and it could use it. I think that chocolate base would be there if they pumped up the strength a bit. There is some light milk chocolate with some some dark chocolate depth. Nice, creamy feel, particularly for a growler pour. Smooth, relatively low carbonation. Thick feel for the abv. Another excellent Treehouse beer.

Growler with popery. Ethiopian Yirgacheffe coffee. 
Aroma is very coffee forward with a nice roast character and medium nuttiness. Light creaminess and medium light chocolate notes. Light fruitiness. 
Pours black with faint brown notes on the edges. Moderate, thick, creamy, dark tan head with above average retention that leaves a small layer forever. Moderate lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is slightly roasty with moderate milk chocolate and light bakers chocolate. Moderate strong coffee notes with a bit of nuttiness and fruit. Medium light bitterness with faint alcohol notes. Light sweetness with faint dark caramel and toffee. 
Mouthfeel is medium to medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Medium light stickiness in the finish. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really nice coffee stout. Great coffee character with a good base beer behind it. Not too big and sticky, nice malt character.
Huge black pour with so smoothness. Another great treehouse rendition. The delicious coffee notes make this a perfect beer for any time of day!

Sampled at Julios Spring Beer Fest. Poured black with a tan head. Eye opening espresso aroma. Secondary chocolate malt and vanilla. Flavor is overwhelmingly coffee. Chocolate and vanilla bean hint at sweetness. Full bodied. Fantastic!
Growler. Black pour with tan head. Takeover by roasted coffee aromas. Roasted flavors, mostly coffee, wish this was in my glass every morning t work.
Flip top bottle. Coconut version (not sure if it is the same or another entry). Very subtle coconut (which is fine by me). Chocolate, roasty, coffee, and some vanilla.

Dean was so welcoming! Pours thick dark black coffee in color with a dark caramel head. The aroma is a huge shot of espresso to your nose, so wonderful! The flavor is big coffee on a beautiful thick creamy body! This beer is incredible bringing coffee, roasted malts, and a great balanced body.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2016 Bottle. Pours black with brown head. Nose and taste of super rich coffee, roasted chocolate, earthy toasted nuts, vanilla bean, coffee creamer and a touch of sweet milk chocolate. Medium/full bodied.
Sampled during Julios Spring Beer Fest. Excellent stout! Lots of chocolate and coffee flavors with possibly a hint of anise. One of my favorites from the entire tasting today.
Basically Cafe Mocha the beer, not too sweet and yet has a rich coffee flavor reminiscent of an iced coffee, excellent stuff.
Échantillonné du Extreme beer fest 2014: Une cousine de la Hill Farmstead Earl avec un café noir plus tranchant et une corpulence moins veloutée. Conception sans tache, buvabilité franche.

750 ml growler into a tulip glass. Bottled two days ago. Pours a pitch black with a finger of mocha foam. Nose is hugely roasted coffee beans, Coffee, vanilla, smoke, and nuts. This is a decadent coffee. Taste is similar with smooth chocolate, roast, char, and vanilla. Little caramel and light bitterness. Very delicious and hugely coffee forward. Coating and full mouth feel. Not as large as Founders breakfast stout but a more enjoyable coffee selection. Damn good stuff!!
sample at extreme beer fest, huge roasty but even greater coffee flavors. Rich chocolate and bitter overflavors with light sweetness and milky roastyness. Fantasic beer ,very charming

On tap at the EBF Saturday
Beautiful coffee stout! Great roasty chocolate base with great coffee notes.
Another winner from tree house. Aroma is tons of coffee with nuts, toffee, and a bit of cocoa. Taste is moderately sweet with less coffee coming across. Good stuff.
Pours a dark brown with a chocolate lacing. Heavy notes of coffee followed by chocolate

750ml growler in a tulip. Pours black with a lacy, beige head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, light chocolate, some dough, and light bitterness. Flavor the same with a nice blend of the coffee and the stout. Average texture. A really good beer.
